gameFiles

Class ChinaCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.Card
      • gameFiles.TurnCard
        • gameFiles.ChinaCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<TurnCard>

    public class ChinaCard
extends TurnCard
    Author:
    Mark Wolgin, Josh Davis The ChianCard is so important to the game, that it needed its own values to keep track of who has it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChinaCard

        public ChinaCard(java.lang.String n,
                 java.lang.String d,
                 int c,
                 int e,
                 Side s,
                 boolean sc,
                 int v,
                 java.lang.String cT,
                 Side whoHas)
        Construct the China Card
        Parameters:
        n - Card Name, i.e. Europe Scoring Card.
        n - Card Name, i.e. Europe Scoring Card.
        d - Card Description, Information relevant to the card.
        c - Card Number, The number for the card.
        e - EffectID, The unique identification code for use with in game logic and the Effects class.
        cT - Card Timing, Different cards get shuffled into the deck at different points in the game, such E - Early Game, M - Mid Game, L - Late Game.
        s - Side, the affiliation of the card to the Super Power.
        sc - Special Card, some cards are special, and should not be put back into the game after there use, and such flagged cards will have special logic to manage them.
        v - Card Value, How much power a card has to affect events and actions.
        whoHas - the Side that currently holds the China Card
